input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: MINISTRY OF AGRICULTURE AND RURAL DEVELOPMENT. Summary: Modernization of the E-Logbook System Resulting from the Amendment to Control Regulation 1224/2009 and the Implementing Regulation Assigned to It.. Description: 1. The subject of the order is the modernization of the E-logbook System resulting from the amendment to Control Regulation 1224/2009 and the implementing regulation assigned to it. EU Member States are obliged to establish and operate monitoring centers fisheries, whose main task is to monitor fishing activities and implement appropriate control systems enabling proper supervision of the proper conduct of fishing. The fisheries administration uses many programs enabling the implementation of the above-mentioned purposes, but the key is the electronic fishing log software "e-logbook system". above the system contains all data regarding the register of fishing vessels, catch records, data validation, and allocations fishing quotas, register of violations, etc. Modernization of the system includes the costs of development work, introducing required software modifications, and introducing changes to the computer program after its launch in the customer's environment. Most often it has a purpose changing its operational, system and performance features. 2. The subject of the order will be completed within 2,035 man-hours. Modernization of the E-logbook System resulting from the amendment to Control Regulation 1224/2009 and the assigned implementing regulation. 1. The subject of the order is the modernization of the E-logbook System resulting from the amendment to Control Regulation 1224/2009 and the implementing regulation assigned to it. Part 1 of the order Purchase of a backup server as part of the project entitled Cybersecure local government: 1) The subject of the order is the delivery, installation and configuration of a modern data backup server - 1 piece, implemented in the form of a hardware appliance. The system must meet the requirements for high efficiency, reliability and security of stored data. The ordering party expects that the solution will enable management and backup copies at the level of disks, files and folders, and also support for virtual machines and UEFI/GPT-based systems. The system should offer the functionality of data replication to multiple locations, support for deduplication and compression mechanisms, as well as cooperation with volume shadow copy services (VSS). It is crucial ensuring business continuity and eliminating single points of failure, as well as the availability of service in the Polish language version. Part I: Agricultural tractor with RTK and ISOBUS automatic steering system with a telematics gateway enabling data exchange, with a power of 240-260 HP as a drive source and a communication hub with ISOBUS-controlled machines and a management system farm with access to the portal of satellite biomass maps. 2. Part II: Precision seeder with fertilization, operating based on cooperation with an ISOBUS tractor, with the function of variable dosing of the sowing rate based on soil abundance maps, 4-6 inline. 3.Part III: Cultivation and sowing set, operating based on cooperation with an ISOBUS tractor, with variable dosage function, seeding rate based on soil abundance maps, working width 3.0 - 4.5 m. 4.Part IV: Cultivator with automatic guidance controlled by the ISOBUS standard, weeding/weeding with a camera/sensors (touch sensors) for inter-row cultivation, 4-6 rows. 5. Part V: Satellite guidance system for your tractor enabling two-way data exchange with the system for farm management. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: NATIONAL FUND FOR ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AND WATER MANAGEMENT. Summary: Providing Support and Development Services for the Central Clean Air Base System. Description: The subject of the Agreement is the provision of support and development services for the "Central Clean Air Base" (CBCP) IT system. Support and development services will be provided for not less than 2,000 hours and not more than 7,000 hours. Description of systems IT services covered by the subject of the order and the detailed scope of the services provided are presented in Annex No. 4 to the SWZ. The Ordering Party requires that the order be performed for a maximum period of 48 months from the date of conclusion contract or until the maximum contract value referred to in § 5 section 1 of Annex No. 4 to the SWZ, depending on which event occurs first, provided that the Agreement may be terminated when the pool of man-hours (7,000 man-hours), no more than 0.5% of the pool of unused man-hours will remain, which is 35 man-hours. In such a case, the Ordering Party will inform the Contractor about the exhaustion of the pool of man-hours, no later than when the remaining number of man-hours reaches the indicated threshold (0.5%), which will also constitute information for the Contractor about the end of the Agreement. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN BORDER AND COAST GUARD AGENCY (FRONTEX). Summary: Maritime Analysis Tool. Description: The subject of the contract is a maritime analysis tool to support Frontex-s maritime analysis function by providing capabilities to analyse and derive insights out of ‘big maritime data-. The maritime analytics implies the competent use of the system to support the development and implementation of risk profiles as well as to identify and monitor areas used as embarkation or transit points for irregular migration and cross-border crime. The maritime analytics system should provide a user-friendly interface and include the integration and fusion of data/information from an increased number of sources. In addition, it is requested to enable customized search rules and queries based on specific ship behaviours. The detailed Terms of Reference (ToR) are included in Annex-I. According to the Maritime Analysis Tool ToR (see Annex-I), the ‘usability requirements- are listed as the following functionalities from the risk analysis perspective that the Maritime Analysis Tool should provide to Frontex analysts: a.to capture, store and manage global maritime big data, for at least 5 years previous to the query. b.to fuse and integrate maritime -big data- with vessels- historical data, for at least 5 years previous to the query. c.To allow the export of the query results with the highest available limit - at least 10.000 entries. <br> Doc Title: Maritime analysis tool <br> Contract Type: supplies. Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-02-06. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Border and Coast Guard Agency (Frontex)

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN BORDER AND COAST GUARD AGENCY (FRONTEX)

The maritime analytics system should provide a user-friendly interface and include the integration and fusion of data/information from an increased number of sources. In addition, it is requested to enable customized search rules and queries based on specific ship behaviours. The detailed Terms of Reference (ToR) are included in Annex-I. According to the Maritime Analysis Tool ToR (see Annex-I), the ‘usability requirements- are listed as the following functionalities from the risk analysis perspective that the Maritime Analysis Tool should provide to Frontex analysts: a.to capture, store and manage global maritime big data, for at least 5 years previous to the query. b.to fuse and integrate maritime -big data- with vessels- historical data, for at least 5 years previous to the query. c.To allow the export of the query results with the highest available limit - at least 10.000 entries. <br> Doc Title: Maritime analysis tool <br> Contract Type: supplies

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: POLISH AIR NAVIGATION AGENCY. Summary: Purchase, Processing and Delivery of Historical Ground Traffic Density Data.. Description: The subject of the order is the service of the Contractor providing data on the intensity of ground traffic in the form of a vector grid linked to an attribute table for specific areas in Poland, indicated by the Ordering Party. Implementation of the item The order includes providing the Ordering Party with appropriate vector grids from 10 areas with a total area of up to 11,000 km2, in three stages, including: Stage 1 - maximum 3 areas; Stage 2 - maximum 4 areas; Stage 3 - remaining areas. Accurate a list of areas along with an indication of the stage during which the Contractor is to obtain appropriate data and provide the Ordering Party with an appropriate map will be provided to the Contractor within 5 business days from the date of conclusion of the Agreement. The Ordering Party expects to use: option rights. The Ordering Party has the right to order the Contractor to provide data in the form of a vector grid on the intensity of ground traffic for specific areas in Poland (in addition to those covered by the Subject of the Agreement described in § 1 of the Agreement), indicated by Ordering Party. The maximum area of ​​areas covered by the option law is 4,000 km2. Details regarding the application of the option right are specified in § 2 of Annex No. 2 to the IPU SWZ. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: OLSZTYN COMMUNE. Summary: "Traffic Study and Development of a Traffic Model for the Olsztyn Functional Urban Area". Description: 1. The subject of the order is to carry out a traffic study together with the development of a traffic model for the Olsztyn Functional Urban Area. The main goal of conducting traffic research and developing a traffic model for the Olsztyn Functional Urban Area is obtaining current and reliable data on the travel of residents of Olsztyn and the communes of its functional area and preparing an up-to-date traffic model using this data. These data must include all trips made by respondents indicated dates, on weekdays, during morning and afternoon rush hours, both by individual and collective transport. The ordering party divided the order execution into two stages: 1) Stage I: a) methodological preparation b)survey research in households, c) road traffic measurement, d) measurement of passenger traffic, e) test report. 2) Stage II: a) traffic model and forecasts, b)implementation of the acquired data into macrosimulation software, c) acquisition and delivery of the so-called data Big Date d) report on model construction and traffic forecasts. The detailed scope of the service is specified in the Description of the subject of the Order constituting Appendix No. 8 to the SWZ, and the Draft Provisions of the Agreement constituting Appendix No. 7 to the SWZ. Description: "Preparation and delivery of educational packages for conducting classes in 115 Preschool Education Centers in the BOF area "Integrated Program for the Development of Talents and Key Competencies in Preschool... is to prepare and deliver 1,460 packages educational activities for children aged 5-6 years, carried out in 115 Preschool Education Centers (OWP) from 12 communes of the Białystok Functional Area (OWP) according to Annex No. 1 to OPZ. As part of the service, the Contractor will provide: (A) materials educational: art, office and toys; (B) graphic design and printing of materials, and (C) packaging of educational materials and printouts into "educational packages" and their delivery to the 115th OWP. Educational packages will serve OWP teachers until conducting 4 cycles of classes (so-called Bofka missions), one mission in each of the 4 competence groups: (1) language and culture, (2) modern technologies, (3) healthy development, (4) entrepreneurship - 8 classes in each mission (Cultural Mission, Technological Mission, Mission Ecological and Business Mission) - a total of 32 classes. The "educational package" (1,460 pieces) should be understood as a "classroom package" (1,000 pieces) and a "kindergarten package" (460 pieces) packed in a resealable cardboard box and opening during 8 activities carried out during one mission and storing them in stacks of at least 5 boxes. The "educational package" (1,460 pieces) should be understood as a "classroom package" (1,000 pieces) and a "kindergarten package" (460 pieces) packed in a resealable cardboard box and opening during 8 activities carried out during one mission and storing them in stacks of at least 5 boxes. "Preparation and delivery of educational packages for conducting classes in 115 Preschool Education Centers in the BOF area “Integrated Program for the Development of Talents and Key Competencies in BOF Kindergartens” (Project No. FEPD.08.02-IZ.00-0003/24)” The subject of the order is the preparation and delivery of...

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: ŚREDZKI HOSPITAL OF THE SACRED HEART OF JESUS SP. Z O.O.. Summary: Development of Digital Services and Cybersecurity at the Średzki Sacred Heart Hospital. Description: The subject of the order is "Development of digital services and cybersecurity at the Średzki Hospital of the Sacred Heart of Jesus" by streamlining the functioning and improving the quality of medical care provided by the Średzki Hospital through: integration and expansion of systems information technology of the healthcare provider, digitization of medical documentation important from the point of view of treatment and prevention, activities increasing the level of hospital cybersecurity and implementation of AI solutions and connection to a central data repository medical. The above-mentioned actions will result in improving the functioning of the medical facility, increasing the efficiency of providing services, providing patients with appropriate care and better access to information about their health condition through support the informatization process in the area of ​​health care. A detailed description of the subject of the order, the material scope, is included in the Description of the Subject of the Order constituting Annex No. 3 to the specifications of the terms of the contract (hereinafter referred to as SWZ) and the draft contract. constituting Annex No. 4 to the SWZ. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: MUNICIPAL PURIFICATION COMPANY IN THE CAPITAL CITY OF WARSAW SP. Z O.O.. Summary: Purchase, Delivery and Implementation of a Matrix with Servers and Switches, as Well as Software and Training of the Ordering Party'S Staff. Description: The subject of the order is the purchase, delivery and implementation of a matrix with servers and switches, as well as software and training of the Ordering Party's staff, in accordance with the requirements specified in the SWZ. Purchase, delivery and implementation of a matrix with servers and switches and software and training of the Ordering Party's staff The subject of the order is the purchase, delivery and implementation of a matrix with servers and switches, as well as software and training of the Ordering Party's staff. Main elements of the described item orders: - delivery of arrays, servers, LAN/SAN switches, server, virtualization and backup software; - installation of the above-mentioned hardware, software installation, data migration and updating of your HA environment as described below; - conducting specialist training for selected employees of the Ordering Party in the use of new equipment and software referred to above. I. General requirements: The solution will cover one data processing center. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: INNOBALTICA SP. Z O. OH. Summary: Cloud Computing Administration. Description: The subject of the order is the provision of a cloud infrastructure resource management service for the FALA system provided by the Ordering Party or provided by a company indicated by the Ordering Party. As part of cloud service management, the Contractor is obliged to implement: Monitoring the availability of System configuration elements. Monitoring the use of System resources: RAM and CPU load of System servers, the amount of backup data in the System, the amount of data transferred to and from the System WAVE, data retention management. Cloud infrastructure management: adding System resources in the cloud infrastructure, monitoring network traffic with particular emphasis on the impact on the load and performance of System devices, query monitoring to databases, with particular emphasis on the impact on the load and performance of the System's databases, ensuring the continuity of operation of the Fala system cloud environment The contractor is obliged to manage and maintain the cloud infrastructure system environments within existing Fala system subscriptions (FalaPRD, FalaTST, FalaDEV). Subscriptions to related systems (Sandbox, HD-PRD, HD-TST) are independent and the Contractor does not perform any activities within them. Cloud administration computational The subject of the order is the provision of a cloud infrastructure resource management service for the FALA system provided by the Ordering Party or provided by a company indicated by the Ordering Party.... The "educational package" (1,460 pieces) should be understood as a "classroom package" (1,000 pieces) and a "kindergarten package" (460 pieces) packed in a resealable cardboard box and opening during 8 activities carried out during one mission and storing them in stacks of at least 5 boxes. "Preparation and delivery of educational packages for conducting classes in 115 Preschool Education Centers in the BOF area “Integrated Program for the Development of Talents and Key Competencies in BOF Kindergartens” (Project No. FEPD.08.02-IZ.00-0003/24)” The subject of the order is the preparation and delivery of...

Moreover, failure to divide into parts does not distort competition by limiting the possibility of applying for them. 2. A detailed description and method of execution of the order is included in the Description of the Subject of the Order (OPZ), constituting Annex No. 3 to the SWZ. 3. Summary: Purchase of a Ct Scanner Along with Adaptation of the Laboratory and Commissioning. Description: 1. The subject of the order is the purchase of a CT scanner along with the adaptation of the laboratory and its commissioning. 2. The subject of the order is described in detail in Annex 2 to the SWZ. 3. The Ordering Party does not allow the submission of partial offers. Reason no division into lots: The subject of the contract is of a uniform nature, and dividing the contract into parts would cause excessive organizational and technical difficulties and additional costs of contract execution, as well as the need to coordinate the activities of various contractors fulfilling the order. 4. The subject of the order is to be financed from the financial resources of the Greater Poland Voivodeship for the task entitled: "Purchase of a computed tomography scanner along with adaptation of the laboratory and commissioning." The scope of investment includes modernization of the existing computed tomography laboratory, consisting of replacing the computed tomography scanner and performing the necessary adaptation works to adapt the rooms to the applicable regulations. The scope of adaptation will consist in: enlarging the door opening in the structural wall, painting rooms, replacing door joinery, performing installation works, such as checking the efficiency of the existing mechanical ventilation and cooling installation, including their cleaning, replacing filters and any necessary work, as well as adapting electrical and telecommunications installations to the new device and the target room layout. Procedure with a contract value above the EU thresholds specified in the announcement President of the Public Procurement Office issued pursuant to Art. 3 of the Public Procurement Law. Description: The subject of the order is the delivery of a descriptive station with a PACS system, including implementation, and a system for vacuum-assisted biopsy under ultrasound guidance, divided into 2 parts. The proceedings are conducted in accordance with the Act of September 11, 2019. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: ENEA OPERATOR SP. Z O.O.. Summary: Reconstruction of the 110/15 Kv Wyrzysk [Wyr] Station Along with the Reconstruction of Existing Hv and Mv Line Connections (S-2025-07577). Description: The subject of the order is the implementation of a task including design, delivery, assembly, construction, commissioning and commissioning of the 110/15 kV Wyrzysk [WYR] double-transformer station, hereinafter referred to as GPZ WYRZYSK, along with the demolition of the existing station and restoration of existing HV and MV linear connections. The construction of the new station will functionally replace the currently operating GPZ WYRZYSK, which is scheduled for demolition, and will increase the available connection capacity in the region. Summary: Delivery of his Class Systems, Solutions Enabling the Fulfillment of the Pillars of the Kpo D1.1.2 Program as an Implementation of the Application to the National Recovery and Resilience Plan - Kpo No. Kpod.07.03-Ip.10-0198.... Description: Delivery of HIS class systems, solutions enabling the fulfillment of the pillars of the KPO D1.1.2 program as an implementation of the application to the National Recovery and Resilience Plan - KPO No. KPOD.07.03-IP.10-0198... Public procurement proceedings is conducted in an open tender pursuant to Art. 132 et seq. of the Act of 11 September 2019 Public Procurement Law (Journal of Laws of 2024, item 1320, as amended), hereinafter also referred to as "Pzp". Proceedings with an order value above the thresholds EU regulations specified in the announcement of the President of the Public Procurement Office issued pursuant to Art. 3 of the Public Procurement Law. The Ordering Party envisages the use of the so-called reverse procedure referred to in Art. 139 section 1 of the Public Procurement Law, i.e. the Ordering Party will first carry out an examination and evaluation of the offers, and then will subjectively qualify the Contractor whose offer was rated the highest in terms of the lack of grounds for exclusion and the fulfillment of the conditions for participation in the proceedings. The subject of the order is the supply of HIS class systems, solutions enabling the fulfillment of the pillars of the KPO D1.1.2 program as an implementation of the application to the National Recovery and Resilience Plan - KPO No. KPOD.07.03-IP.10-0198/25. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: PROVINCIAL HEADQUARTERS OF THE STATE FIRE SERVICE IN RZESZÓW. Summary: Cashless Purchase of Fuel for Means of Transport for the Needs of the Provincial Headquarters of the State Fire Service in Rzeszów Throughout the Country. Description: The subject of the order is the delivery of the above-mentioned quantities and types of liquid fuels through gas stations accepting cashless fuel cards for vehicles and motor equipment owned by the Provincial Headquarters of the State Fire Service in Rzeszów in estimated quantity: a) Approximately 10,000 liters of unleaded gasoline (Pb-95) per year, b) Approximately 27,000 liters of diesel oil (ON) per year. When entering the tender, the contractor should have fuel stations throughout the country. Delivery of the order item will be carried out on the basis of ad hoc, cashless refueling of vehicles to their tanks at the selected station of the supplier who submitted the most advantageous offer. The subject of the order will be collected on the basis of issued fuel cards with the possibility of blocking the card in in the event of reporting loss or theft. The Supplier will provide fuel cards issued to the Ordering Party, authorizing them to make cashless transactions with operators running fuel stations. A detailed description of the subject of the order is included in a. No. 2 to SWZ - Description the subject of the order, and the detailed terms of implementation. No. 4 to SWZ - Draft contract. Summary: Design, Construction and Launch of the Intelligent Transport System in Radom (Hereinafter Referred to as the "Its System") in Connection with the Implementation of the Project Entitled: "Development of Urban Mobility Infrastructure.... Description: Design, construction and launch of the Intelligent Transport System in Radom (hereinafter referred to as the "ITS System") in connection with the implementation of the project entitled: "Development of urban mobility infrastructure... The subject of the order is design, construction and launch of the Intelligent Transport System in Radom (hereinafter referred to as the "ITS System") in connection with the implementation of the project entitled: "Development of urban mobility infrastructure in the Radom Functional Area - stages I and II". The order is being processed is in the "design and build" mode, so it consists of two basic stages: the design stage and the implementation stage. The order includes the design, installation and commissioning of the ITS system and the reconstruction of selected geometries intersections. The order includes: - reconstruction and construction of traffic lights at 39 intersections and pedestrian crossings, - adaptation of traffic lights at 39 intersections and pedestrian crossings to work in the ITS system, - implementation on the 39th intersections and pedestrian crossings equipped with traffic lights, priority for public transport, - delivery and launch of an IT application integrating ITS subsystems, - reconstruction of the geometry of intersections, - Center equipment Traffic Control and server room, - implementation of a data transmission network, - delivery of electric vehicles. The subject of the order was specified in detail in the Description of the Subject Matter of the Order (OPZ) - Annex No. 11 to the SWZ and the Functional and Utility Program (FFU). constituting Annex No. 6 to the OPZ. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: POLISH AGENCY FOR ENTERPRISE DEVELOPMENT. Summary: Modification of the it System of the Development Services Database. Description: 1. The subject of the order is the provision of specialized services related to the modification and expansion of the Development Services Database (BUR), consisting of analytical, programming, testing, installation works, and preparation of documentation, in accordance with emerging needs, as well as providing warranty service. The execution of the order will consist in the submission by the Ordering Party, in the form of individual orders, of the scope of work regarding the modification or expansion of BUR. Orders individual items may include, among others: implementing new functionalities, adding support for new processes or modifying existing ones, implementing artificial intelligence for process automation, implementing recommendations resulting from security tests, tests performance, implementation of changes to improve the availability and usability of the System, integration with other IT systems. Individual orders will be submitted as the Ordering Party's needs arise. The order will be made implemented under the non-competitive PARP project No. FERS.01.03-IP.09-0005/23 "Expansion of the functionality of the Development Services Database and its dissemination as a tool supporting the learning process of adults" implemented under Measure 01.03 European Funds for Social Development program co-financed by the European Social Fund Plus. The Ordering Party envisages concluding a framework agreement referred to in Art. 311 - 315 of the Public Procurement Law. Ordering party will conclude a framework agreement with a maximum of 5 (five) Contractors (and each subsequent Contractor who obtains the same number of points as the last qualified Contractor) who meet the conditions for participation in the procedure, are not subject to exclusion, and their offers are not will be subject to rejection pursuant to Art. 226 of the Public Procurement Law and will obtain the highest number of points in the offer evaluation criteria. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: MASOVIAN VOIVODESHIP. Summary: 139_Purchase of Technical Support for Gis Software for the Purpose of Updating Data Sets of Topographic Objects. Description: The subject of the order is the purchase of technical support for GIS software for the purpose of updating data sets of topographic objects, divided into two parts of the order. GeoMedia Professional, ERDAS IMAGINE Advantage, Geospatial Portal SDK The subject of the Agreement includes: 1) technical support for GeoMedia Professional software - 7 CC network licenses (floating) until December 31, 2029; 2) technical support for ERDAS IMAGINE Advantage software - 1 CC network license (floating) up to 31 December 2029; 3) provision of the Geospatial Portal SDK subscription service until December 31, 2029. ArcGIS The subject of the Agreement includes: 1) migration of the ArcGIS Desktop software license to a new licensing method - as a result of the migration, the Ordering Party had will be: a)1 ArcGIS Professional Plus perpetual license; b)4 ArcGIS Professional perpetual licenses; c) Data Interoperability for ArcGIS Pro extension for 1 user; d) ArcGIS Enterprise Standard license 2) technical support (license service) the software referred to in point 1, until December 31, 2029. Doc Title: 139_Purchase of technical support for GIS software for the purpose of updating data sets of topographic objects Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-12-15. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: CHEŁMIEC COMMUNE. Summary: Construction of a Village Community Center Building with Technical Infrastructure in the Town of Ubiad. Description: The subject of the procedure and order is to select a contractor for construction works related to the implementation of the investment task called Construction of a village community center building with technical infrastructure in the town of Ubiad. The scope of the order includes the construction of a new community center building rural, detached buildings with the necessary infrastructure. In addition to the building in question, it is planned to build a septic tank for sewage, two water tanks and local hardening of the construction plot with entry from the internal road. The contractor is obliged to obtain an occupancy permit. The contractor must offer: 1) at least a 3-year warranty period for the entire subject of the order; 2) a 5-year warranty period for the entire subject of the order. The work must be carried out in accordance with the documentation designs, technical specifications for the execution and acceptance of construction works, which constitute Annex No. 7 to the SWZ and Annex No. 8 to the SWZ, respectively. The conditions of the order execution were included in the draft provisions of the contract, which constitute Annex No. 6 to the SWZ.. Published Date: 2025-12-13. Closing Date: 2026-01-15. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: NICOLAUS COPERNICUS MAIN SCHOOL. Summary: Delivery and Implementation of an Integrated System for Managing Teaching, Organizational and Administrative Processes of the University with Support Services, Hosting and Full Integration. Description: The subject of the order is the provision of a comprehensive IT service including the provision, delivery, implementation and full integration of an IT system in the SaaS (Software as a Service) formula, supporting university management in the field of teaching, organizational and administrative. The aim of the system is to improve processes related to serving students and doctoral students, including people with disabilities and special needs, and to ensure effective and accessible access to university services and resources. System must be fully integrated with the VERBIS system operating at the Nicolaus Copernicus School (including data of students, users and organizational structure). The Ordering Party has Verbis software/modules (recruitment, dean's office). The Contractor must will provide all other functionalities compatible with the modules owned by the Ordering Party or propose the implementation of a different/new solution at the university as part of the order.. Published Date: 2025-12-13. Closing Date: 2025-12-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: MINISTRY OF JUSTICE. Summary: Data Transmission Service. Description: The subject of the order is a data transmission service. Pursuant to point 7 Terms of Order Specification (SWZ): Contractors who meet the conditions for participation in the procedure regarding technical or technical capacity may apply for the contract professional. The contractor will meet the condition if it proves that in the last 5 years before the deadline for submitting offers, and if the period of running the business is shorter - during this period, it has performed, and in the case of repeated or continuous services also performs, at least two services, each of which met the minimum requirements: 7.1. the subject of the service was/is data transmission; 7.2. the scope of the service concerned/applies to the IP VPN network infrastructure; 7.3. the service concerned/concerns 200 geographically distinct locations; 7.4. the service was/is provided continuously for a period of 12 months; 7.5. the value of the service was/is PLN 2,000,000.00 gross for a period of 12 months. In the case of services still provided, the value of each service it must concern the part that has already been performed, and not the whole, including the future scope of the service that has not been performed. In the case of services still performed, the Ordering Party requires that the subject of each of these services be provided at least to the extent required for demonstrating compliance with the condition for participation in the proceedings. The concept of geographically distinct locations means locations with different addresses. A different location will not be a location that differs only in the apartment number. AT.... Published Date: 2025-12-12. Closing Date: 2025-12-30. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

A detailed description of the subject of the order (OPZ) is included in Annex No. 11 to the SWZ and in The draft provisions of the contract constituting Annex No. 2 to the SWZ. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: POLISH STATE RAILWAYS S.A.. Summary: Extension of Sap Standard Support Support Services. Description: The subject of the order is the purchase of SAP Standard Support services for SAP ERP program licenses held by PKP S.A. from the date of conclusion of the Agreement until December 31, 2026, provided that all corrections and improvements are made available to the Ordering Party SAP software issued by SAP until the date of signing the Agreement Extension of SAP Standard Support support services 1. The subject of the order is the purchase of SAP Standard Support support services for SAP ERP program licenses held by PKP ARE. from the date of conclusion of the Agreement until December 31, 2026, provided that it provides the Ordering Party with all amendments and improvements to the SAP Software issued by SAP until the date of signing the Agreement. The scope of support includes, among others: the following services: 1) updates software, service support packages, administrative support tools, 2) global service facilities in the form of access to the reporting system, consultations and expert knowledge base, 3) support critical operations through access to analyzes and support for addressing critical issues identified in the 24/7 system, 4) diagnostic tools, access to system monitoring tools and other services for performance optimization. 2. The detailed scope is included in draft contract containing the Description of the Subject of the Order, which constitutes Annex No. 8 to the SWZ. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: MULTI-SPECIALTY HOSPITAL - INDEPENDENT PUBLIC HEALTH CARE COMPLEX IN ZGORZELEC. Summary: Implementation of a System for Digitization and Archiving of Medical Documentation Along with the Purchase of Server Infrastructure and Migration of the his Environment for Ws - Sp Zoz in Zgorzelec.. Description: The subject of the order is: Implementation of a system for digitization and archiving of medical documentation along with the purchase of server infrastructure and migration of the HIS environment for WS - SP ZOZ in Zgorzelec. The description of the subject of the order is included in attachments no. 2, 3, 4, 7 to SWZ. No. consistent with SWZ:2.1. The Ordering Party does not allow the submission of partial offers. Justification for not dividing into parts: The reason for the lack of division into parts is the complementarity and compatibility of solutions - each device and system has its own own features, therefore, when divided into parts, we may lead to a situation in which we will not achieve the full effectiveness of individual elements (practice shows that the systems, despite offering similar functionalities, do not guarantee full integration with leading device but also other elements of the IT system). Therefore, dividing the order into parts would result in a risk of lack of full compatibility between the servers, disk array, buckup system and virtualization environment. At the same time, it should be noted that each of the well-known suppliers on the market uses the help of sub-suppliers of equipment or services to a greater or lesser extent, so there is no question of limiting competition for smaller suppliers. 2.2. The Ordering Party allows submitting equivalent offers. If, in the description of the subject of the order, the Ordering Party specifies the subject of the order by indicating trademarks, patents or origin, source or specific process that.... Description: Modernization of land and building records for the cadastral unit or individual cadastral districts by creating digital EGiB databases or improving the quality and validity of EGiB databases, along with bringing these databases into compliance with the EGiB conceptual data model specified in Annex No. 6 to the Regulation of the Minister of Labor Development and Technology of July 27, 2021 on the register of land and buildings (Journal of Laws of 2024, item 219), hereinafter referred to as the "Regulation on "EGiB". Creation and modernization of EGiB digital databases for the implementation of the project "e-Geodesy II - supplementing the digital geodetic resource of the Lublin Voivodeship" - stage III, part 88. A detailed description of the subject of the order is set out in Annex No 88 to SWZ. The ordering party does not require a deposit. The service titled: "Migration of SCADA control and visualization systems to the latest version of Siemens PCS7 for STUOŚ" includes, among others: 1) updating (upgrading) the current SCADA system to the latest version SIEMENS PCS7 along with maintaining the efficiency of the automation and SCADA systems installed in the STUOŚ at the "Sitkówka" Sewage Treatment Plant, 2) delivery of licenses, software and hardware necessary to migrate the PCS7 system and ensure the current functionality of the control system for the Sewage Treatment Plant at the "Sitkówka" Sewage Treatment Plant, 3) implementation of the modernized system and training of the Ordering Party's employees, 4) engineering of the PCS7 application based on APL/IL standard and Water templates, 5) servicing the subject of the order during the warranty and warranty period. The contractor will propose and deliver a full hardware solution (including servers, backup equipment, etc.) adapted to the offered system. Warszawska 32). Data transmission is to be carried out using GePON technology fiber optics terminated with an ONU device 4x Fast Ethernet or 1x Gigabit Ethernet with a bandwidth of 4x100Mb or 1x1Gb. The device is to be brand new, with a full warranty period (minimum 24 months) covering both hardware and software.
